description: Conversion of garage to habitable use, part two storey, part single storey rear extension, part two storey, part single storey side extension, 2 side dormers and roof lights (part retrospective application); front porch extension, installation of a vehicle crossover, front boundary treatment and driveway
decision_conditions: Within 6 months of the date of this permission the approved on-site parking provision and vehicle crossover shall be fully implemented. The hard surface for the parking provision shall be made of porous materials, or provision shall be made to direct run-off water from the hard surface to a permeable or porous area or surface within the curtilage of the dwelling house.
REASON
To ensure that an appropriate level of car parking provision is provided on site with suitable access, in accordance with Policies DMHD 1 and DMT 6 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on Drawing Nos.
Location Plan
REASON
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020), and the London Plan (2021).

Notwithstanding the approved drawings, within one month of the date of this planning permission details of the raised terrace at the rear of the dwelling shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. These details shall specify the depth and height of the proposed terrace, relative to the ground levels of adjoining neighbouring properties and existing boundary treatments. Details of any proposed privacy screens shall also be submitted. The approved details shall be fully implemented within two months of their formal approval, and shall thereafter be retained as such.
REASON
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building and shall thereafter be retained as such. The facing brick front boundary wall, hereby approved, shall match the brick used in the external elevations of the dwelling and shall thereafter be retained as such.
REASON

To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to ensure that the proposed development does not have an adverse effect upon the appearance of the existing building in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Notwithstanding the approved drawings a minimum of 25% of the front garden area shall be soft landscaped (for example, grass or planted beds) for so long as the development remains in existence. This shall be fully implemented during the first planting season following the grant of this planning permission.
REASON
To ensure the proposed development will preserve and enhance the visual amenities of the locality in compliance with Policies DMHD 1, DMHB 11 and DMHB 14 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Access to the flat roof over the converted garage and extensions hereby approved shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, balcony, patio or similar amenity area.
REASON
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no additional windows, doors or other openings shall be constructed in the walls or roof slopes of the development hereby approved.
REASON
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The first floor window(s) in the side elevation facing 20 Highfield Road and Windrush shall be glazed with permanently obscured glass to at least scale 4 on the Pilkington scale and be non-opening below a height of 1.8 metres taken from internal finished floor level for so long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

You are advised that if any part of the development hereby permitted encroaches by either its roof, walls, eaves, gutters, or foundations, then a new planning application may have to be submitted.
